skill.name: slack-gif-creator
skill.description: Toolkit for creating animated GIFs optimized for Slack, with validators for size constraints and composable animation primitives. This skill applies when users request animated GIFs or emoji animations for Slack from descriptions like "make me a GIF for Slack of X doing Y".

skill.author: ArtemisAI

security_audit.summary: This is a pure image processing library for creating animated GIFs. No network calls, no code execution risks, no sensitive data access. All capabilities (frame generation, easing functions, validators) are appropriate for GIF creation. Well-structured code with no obfuscation or suspicious patterns.

content.value_statement: Creating animated GIFs for Slack requires meeting strict size limits and using appropriate animation techniques. This toolkit provides validators, animation primitives, and optimization tools to create message GIFs and custom emoji that work flawlessly in Slack.
actual_capabilities: Validate GIFs against Slack size limits (64KB for emoji, 2MB for messages)
Create 12 animation primitives including shake, bounce, spin, pulse, and zoom
Generate optimized GIFs with color quantization and frame deduplication
Build particle effects, text overlays, and visual impact effects
Apply easing functions for natural motion (bounce, elastic, back easing)
Use color palettes and typography for professional results
limitations: Requires Pillow, imageio, and numpy dependencies
Emoji rendering depends on system font support (Apple Color Emoji on macOS)
File size optimization may require manual adjustments for complex designs
Does not support GIF editing of existing files

use_cases.title: Custom Reaction GIFs
use_cases.description: Create unique reaction GIFs for your team that express your brand personality.

use_cases.title: Status and Loading Animations
use_cases.description: Build custom loading spinners and status indicators for your applications.

use_cases.title: Slack Emoji Packs
use_cases.description: Design animated emoji that stay under 64KB for Slack custom emoji upload.

prompt_templates.title: Simple Reaction
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a pulsing heart emoji GIF at 128x128 pixels optimized for Slack emoji. Use smooth pulse animation with 10-12 frames.

prompt_templates.title: Impact Animation
prompt_templates.scenario: Add visual impact to a message
prompt_templates.prompt: Make an animated GIF showing a bouncing ball with an explosion effect at impact. Size 480x480, 30 frames, use bounce_out easing.

prompt_templates.title: Custom Emoji
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a 128x128 animated emoji of a shaking warning sign. Limit to 12 frames and 40 colors to stay under 64KB. Include impact flash on first and last frame.

prompt_templates.title: Complex Scene
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a 480x480 message GIF with a character moving across the screen while pulsing. Use move and pulse animations together. Add particle burst at the destination. Optimize for under 2MB.

output_examples.input: Create a bouncing celebration emoji GIF for Slack

best_practices: Start with simple designs and add complexity incrementally while checking file size
Use the built-in validators frequently when creating emoji GIFs under 64KB
Apply easing functions (bounce_out, elastic_out) for natural-feeling motion
anti_patterns: Using too many colors (keep emoji GIFs under 48 colors)
Creating more than 15 frames for emoji GIFs
Forgetting to validate file size before uploading to Slack
Using gradients in emoji GIFs (solid colors compress better)

faq.question: What size should Slack message GIFs be?
faq.answer: Optimal dimensions are 480x480 pixels with max 2MB file size. Use 15-20 FPS for smooth animation.

faq.question: How small can custom emoji GIFs be?
faq.answer: Slack custom emoji must stay under 64KB. Use 128x128 pixels, 10-12 frames, and 32-48 colors maximum.

faq.question: Which dependencies are required?
faq.answer: Install pillow>=10.0.0, imageio>=2.31.0, imageio-ffmpeg>=0.4.9, and numpy>=1.24.0.

faq.question: Is user data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only processes images in memory and writes to user-specified file paths. No data leaves the system.

faq.question: Why is my emoji GIF too large?
faq.answer: Common causes include too many frames, too many colors, gradients, or large dimensions. Reduce frames to 10-12 and colors to 32-40.

faq.question: How does this compare to online GIF makers?
faq.answer: This skill provides programmatic control over every frame with validation built-in. It produces optimized files specifically for Slack requirements.
